Common.title: Image Collection Manager
Common.description: A tool for generating and managing IIIF (International Image Interoperability Framework) compliant manifests

Example.title: Example Page
Example.description: Explore the main features available in this template.

feature1.title: Internationalization
feature1.description: Full i18n support with next-intl. Easily add and manage multiple languages.

feature2.title: Dark Mode
feature2.description: System-aware dark mode with next-themes. Automatically switches based on user preference.

feature3.title: Server Side Rendering
feature3.description: Dynamic content with Next.js SSR. Optimized for SEO and real-time data.

feature4.title: Responsive Design
feature4.description: Fully responsive with Tailwind CSS. Beautiful on all devices and screen sizes.

Dashboard.title: My Collections
Dashboard.deleteCollectionError: An error occurred while deleting the collection.
Dashboard.viewInSelfMuseumTooltip: View public collections in Self Museum

Collection.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{title}"?
Collection.confirmDeleteItem: Are you sure you want to delete this item?

CollectionEdit.title: Collection Settings
CollectionEdit.multilingualNote: Multilingual support: Set collection title and description in Japanese and English.
CollectionEdit.privateNote: Only you can view this collection

NewCollection.title: Create New Collection
NewCollection.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter a description for this collection (optional)
NewCollection.publicNote: When enabled, this collection will be accessible to anyone through the IIIF endpoint. You can configure detailed settings after creation.

ItemEdit.title: Edit Item
ItemEdit.clickMapToSetLocation: Click on the map to set location. Tokyo is displayed by default.

NewItem.title: Create New Item
NewItem.dragDropNote: Drag & drop images here, or click to select
NewItem.supportedFormats: Supported formats: JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP (Max 10MB)

PublicCollectionSettings.title: Public Collection Settings
PublicCollectionSettings.settingsDescription: Configure the title and description of your entire public collection as displayed in external viewers like Self Museum.
PublicCollectionSettings.note: These settings will be reflected in the IIIF manifest for your entire public collection. Individual collection settings can be changed from each collection's edit page.

IIIFParser.title: IIIF Parser / Converter (Experimental)
IIIFParser.description: Convert IIIF v2 manifests/collections to v3 format
IIIFParser.experimentalNote: This is an experimental feature that uses @iiif/parser to parse and convert IIIF resources.
IIIFParser.urlPlaceholder: Enter IIIF manifest or collection URL
IIIFParser.aboutDescription: This tool uses the @iiif/parser library to parse and convert IIIF Presentation API resources.
IIIFParser.feature1: Automatic conversion from IIIF v2 to v3
IIIFParser.feature3: Input via URL or direct JSON

ItemEditModal.title: Edit Item
ItemEditModal.usageTermsDescription: Description (e.g. Please contact us before secondary use)

ImageUploader.title: Add Images
ImageUploader.dragDrop: Drag & drop images here, or click to select
ImageUploader.supportedFormats: Supported formats: JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP (Max 10MB per file)

IIIFCollectionImporter.description: Import multiple manifests from a IIIF Collection

CollectionMap.clickToSetLocation: Click on the map to set location

ItemEditPage.title: Edit Item
ItemEditPage.clickMapToSetLocation: Click on the map to set location. Tokyo is displayed by default.
ItemEditPage.additionalInfoNote: Information added here will be displayed as detailed item information. You can freely add various information about the item such as creation year, author, technique, size, etc.
ItemEditPage.usageTermsDescription: Description (e.g. Please contact us before secondary use)
ItemEditPage.customFieldsMultilingual: Custom fields support multiple languages. You can set labels and values in Japanese and English.
ItemEditPage.multilineNote: To enter multiple values, separate them with line breaks
ItemEditPage.georefDescription: Georeferencing allows mapping image coordinates to real geographic coordinates. This embeds location information in the IIIF manifest.

authMethod.title: API Authentication Methods
authMethod.sessionDescription: You are currently logged in, so you can call APIs directly from your browser. The 'Try it out' feature in Swagger UI also executes using your current session.
authMethod.programmaticDescription: To access the API from external programs, use the following methods:
authMethod.cookieAuthDescription: Include browser session cookies in your requests
authMethod.bearerTokenDescription: Use tokens obtained from IIIF Auth API (for private resources)

usage.title: How to Use
usage.step2: Select the API endpoint you want to use

notes.title: Important Notes
notes.note1: Requests from Swagger UI use your current browser session
notes.note2: API access will be disabled after logging out
notes.note3: Owner permissions are required to access private items
notes.note4: IIIF image authentication may require a separate Bearer token
